events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection, requesting immediate assistance.
Review team assigned the claim to the 'Auto Accident' category after verifying the nature of the incident described in the report.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to manage and follow up with the customer throughout the claim process.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming receipt of the claim and outlining the next steps to be taken.
Customer was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage, the police report, and a copy of their driver’s license for verification.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of the damaged car and the official police accident report.
Investigators began a detailed review of the submitted evidence and contacted the involved parties for further clarification.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and validation of all claim details consistent with policy coverage.
A settlement amount covering repair costs and rental car expenses was proposed to the customer based on investigation findings.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the timely processing and resolution proposal, requesting to proceed with payment.
Claim approval was finalized internally, confirming full coverage of the proposed settlement amount under policy terms.
The payment covering all agreed costs was issued to the customer’s bank account to facilitate vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirming customer receipt of funds and repair shop scheduling completed.
